intro: Athamanta libanotis var. pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a hairy texture, while the stems are erect and branching. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in alpine gardens.
